attributes.action: Ensure that a Prime Minister is elected by General Election or ballot of MPs.
attributes.additional_details: Our last 3 Prime Ministers have come into office after an election by party members. In a Parliamentary Democracy voters elect a member of parliament to represent their interests and follow the mandate received by their party. It is undemocratic for a Prime Minister to be selected other than by a vote of MP’s or by a General Election.
attributes.background: When a replacement leader of the Party of Government is required this shall be by secret ballot of that parties MPs. Should the party of government attempt to hold a ballot of members to indicate their choice of leader this should trigger a General Election within 6 weeks.

rejection.details:
We can only accept petitions about things the Government or Parliament are directly responsible for.

Decisions about how party leaders are chosen are a matter for individual political parties, not the UK Government or Parliament.

We have published the following petitions, which you might like to sign:

If a Prime Minister resigns a general election should be called: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/620016

Impose new requirements on replacing the Prime Minister and subsequent election: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/623200
